p: Compounds 23– 24, 26 and 28 were evaluated for their antimicrobial activities against the Gram-positive strains Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 and Mycobacterium smegmatis ATCC 607, Gram-negative strains Escherichia coli ATCC 8739 and Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 9027, by the liquid growth inhibition in 96-well microplates. Compounds 23– 24, 26 and 28 displayed mild antibacterial activities against the Gram positive strain Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 with IC 50 values ranging from 31.5 to 41.9 µM [ 18].
